intro: Anecio, commonly known as the water plantain, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Alismataceae. These aquatic or semi-aquatic plants are characterized by their narrow, ribbon-like leaves that float on the water surface or grow submerged. They typically produce small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in spikes. Anecio species are often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and streams. Their ability to thrive in waterlogged soils makes them important components of aquatic ecosystems.
